programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S01E02

programme.title: Trucking Hell

S05E13

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
A fire extinguisher is launched at officers from a fleeing getaway car at 165mph along the M1. An insight into the working life of officers patrolling Britain's roads
S09E01

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A failure to stop in Hartlepool turns into an armed stand-off and a full-blown kidnapping situation, while a 14-year-old boy is found in possession of a bag of crack cocaine, cash and a knife. Lee goes on a high-speed pursuit through Stockton, and Jacko and Simon tackle a drug driver who is wearing a balaclava
S14E06

programme.title: The Red Badge of Courage (1951)
programme.desc: Audie Murphy plays a farm worker whose life is changed by the violence of combat in the Union Army. Drama based on the classic American Civil War novel by Stephen Crane, co-starring Bill Mauldin, Douglas Dick, Royal Dano and John Dierkes

programme.title: Column South (1953)
programme.desc: A Cavalry officer who has been the lifelong friend of a Navajo chief works to ensure peace is maintained between their people. As the first conflicts of the Civil War begin, a group of Confederate agents plots to undermine the Union by tricking the two old friends into waging war on each other. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Dennis Weaver

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
A serious blaze leaves an eight-wheel sewage tanker stricken in a layby on the busy A1 motorway just north of Grantham in Lincolnshire. A car that's trapped on a riverbed at the bottom of a steep grassy embankment needs rescue, while a bin lorry is stuck on a sodden verge
S05E14

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Police from Derbyshire are on a campaign to round up wanted criminals on the run, and officer Matt Copestake joins a high-speed pursuit of a man wanted across two counties. North of Chesterfield, Andy Swift receives intel on the whereabouts of car linked to a wanted suspect, and units from across the county close in on the suspect car and its occupants
S07E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler Darren calls on all his powers of persuasion to try to end a roof-top stand-off, and Steve is forced to use his pepper spray when a suspect refuses to come quietly. Plus, there is a tense stand-off with a man armed with a knife
S14E09

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Chris and the team are in pursuit of a stolen Mazda M3, but the driver disappears into an industrial area and tracker dog Ronny tries to track down the villain. Meanwhile, a routine stop and search takes a dangerous turn for Jimmy, and Liam helps take down a banned driver who causes carnage at a red light
S14E10

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
With North Yorkshire's roads a big draw for bikers, policing them is a top priority. A 70-year-old biker crashes down an embankment but is spared serious injury thanks to a gadget
S12E17

programme.title: King Arthur (2004)
programme.desc: A Roman commander is posted to Britain in the last days of the empire and given a final mission to rescue a high-ranking official and his son stranded in the north. However, the endeavour reveals his true destiny is to lead the Britons against the new Saxon invasion, and marks the start of a legend. Historical adventure, starring Clive Owen, Keira Knightley, Ray Winstone, Ioan Gruffudd and Stephen Dillane

programme.title: Crimson Tide (1995)
programme.desc: A veteran US submarine captain receives an incomplete message after a Russian base falls into rebel hands, and is convinced it is an order to fire his nuclear weapons. However, his first officer refuses to take such potentially devastating action without confirmed orders, leading to a deadly battle of wills. Thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Denzel Washington and Viggo Mortensen

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Tanker driver Sludge tries to dodge disaster, while Steve Graham suffers from his worst nightmare on the road, and rough weather places Macca McReady in jeopardy
S03E04

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals Caught on Camera: A one-off edition of the documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis reveals how CCTV and technological advances are helping to ensure convictions. Nick visits Stafford to meet seasoned CCTV operator and ex-police officer Barbara, who helps catch a drug user after spotting him on camera. Plus, control room operative Chris is on the lookout for regular shoplifters in Woking, while mild-mannered Jo foils a gang of thieves in Huntingdonshire
S02E02

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
In the Grand Canyon, a massive microburst causes a dangerous deluge of mud and rocks to barrel down on a group of kayakers - leaving them in need of urgent medical assistance
S04E08

programme.title: Fort Worth (1951)
programme.desc: A former gunman starts a new life as the editor of a newspaper in a small Texan town, but clashes with a powerful land baron whose underhand dealings he is about to expose. Tension escalates further when an enemy from the past rides into town, leaving him with no choice but to buckle on his six-guns one more time. Western drama, starring Randolph Scott, Phyllis Thaxter and David Brian

programme.title: A Big Hand for the Little Lady (1966)
programme.desc: A poker player plans to renounce his gambling ways and become a farmer to support his family. When he learns of a high-stakes game he cannot resist, but ends up losing everything and suffering a heart attack. His wife steps into the breach to finish the game and try to win back her savings - but she has never played poker before. Western, starring Henry Fonda, Joanne Woodward and Jason Robards

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Derbyshire's Road Crime Unit uses intelligence and surveillance tactics to crack down on suspected drug dealers. The team receives some intelligence about a man suspected of ferrying drugs into the county using a relative's car. After boxing the car to a stop, a struggle breaks out between the driver and road crime cop Nick Lovatt, and the suspect is forcibly cuffed and detained
S09E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers pursue a fleeing Vauxhall Astra through the streets of north Hartlepool at more than 100mph, but are forced to call the chase off and the driver later robs a supermarket at knife-point, sparking a huge manhunt. Liam and his sniffer dog Louie take part in the search of a house that uncovers thousands in cash and nearly £500,000 in class A drugs, while firearms officers rush to Guisborough at 11pm on a Friday after a caller claims that a man with a shotgun is walking around the town
S14E13

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Documentary following the work of elite crime-fighting units, this time riding along with officers covering the West Yorkshire region. In the first edition, Jo and Mike track down a VW Golf that was involved in a robbery to a petrol station, but as they try to stop the driver, the fleeing car slams into Jo and then smashes through the pumps in a desperate bid to escape
S15E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Inspector Anton Sullivan pulls over a driver on the M6 who has a rubber boat unsecurely tied to the roof of his car. Meanwhile, on the M62, PC Niaz Waddington tries to catch up with a speeding SUV and is shocked to discover the reason for the dangerous speed when he pulls the vehicle over
S02E10

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
In South Wales, Kings Heavy Haulage driver Craig tackles a 60-ton piling rig used in setting foundations for large buildings, which needs to be moved across the River Severn
S02E05

programme.desc:

programme.title: Angel and the Badman (1947)
programme.desc: A gunslinger determined to track down his father's killer is badly wounded and taken in by a Quaker family, whose daughter nurses him back to health. His attraction to the girl and growing respect for the family's peaceful way of life lead him to consider renouncing violence - but his desire for revenge proves hard to surrender. Western, starring John Wayne, Bruce Cabot and Gail Russell

programme.title: Rio Grande (1950)
programme.desc: A cavalry officer has to avoid showing preferential treatment when the son he has not seen for 15 years is posted to his fort as a cadet. His estranged wife also turns up wanting to take the boy away, but he is forced to put duty before his family when called on to rescue children kidnapped by Apaches on the Mexican border. John Ford's Western, with John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Ben Johnson and J Carrol Naish

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
A 38-ton mail lorry crashes on a London street, and a bashed-up Audi is wedged in a ditch on a busy country road
S05E15

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Karl is called to an accident involving a driver in his seventies who has reversed into a house and ruptured a gas main. With the elderly man trapped in his car, it's a full-scale emergency for Karl and his colleagues to free the driver and prevent an explosion. On the outskirts of Derby, traffic cop Jason is called to a mystery crash involving a middle-aged woman who has rolled her car on a quiet suburban street. Unsure why or how the accident has occurred, Jason is left gobsmacked when the truth is revealed
S09E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Chris Spencer and the team chase a Golf GTI racing through the streets at three times the speed limit, while reports of gunshots at a house party on a residential street lead to a full-scale firearms operation
S15E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler Steve and the firearms team are involved in a dramatic doorstep showdown in which a man is alleged to have attacked someone with an axe and a machete. A stolen van makes off from officers in Leeds before nearly hitting a dog walker, while a tactical pursuit and containment collars a disqualified driver who tries to pull the wool over the interceptors' eyes
S15E04

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Officers begin an investigation after a driver loses control of his car and hits a motorway central reservation before spinning out of control and crossing two live lanes of the A1. The driver claims a mechanical fault caused the crash, but officers think differently when he is quizzed about his phone being used at the time of the accident. In York, a pedestrian is knocked down and left with serious head injuries, and police officers have to find out what happened and who is at fault
S12E18

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc:
Documentary following the work of police officers and detectives as they attempt to identify those responsible for criminal acts, exploring the intricacies of producing irrefutable evidence, conducting interviews and finding ways to make the guilty confess. The first edition focuses on an armed robbery in Norfolk in which a vehicle is stolen and innocent people are shot
S01E01

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S06E03

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc:
A police dog unit is called in to try to track down a driver and passenger who have gone missing after a late-night crash on a busy road. The cops think they have their suspects when they stop a couple seen nearby, but when they deny all knowledge of the accident it's down to the officers to link them to the crashed vehicle
S02E07

programme.title: Frontline Police 24/7
programme.desc:
The story of how the 2020 Super Bowl parade in Kansas ended with a dramatic police chase through the streets, and a controlled takedown just yards from a massive crow
S01E08

programme.title: Frontline Police 24/7
programme.desc:
Documentary examining the danger police officers around the world face in the line of duty, featuring footage from bodycams, force helicopters and CCTV
S01E09

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals Caught on Camera: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV is helping to bring criminals using weapons to justice. A CCTV operator's instincts lead him to keep an eye on a man acting suspiciously on a train station platform and who then takes a knife out of his pocket and threatens a woman coming towards him. There is also footage of a raid on a west London jewellery shop, with the gang spraying bleach in the eyes of security guards and smashing down the doors with pickaxes while the terrified staff cower inside
S02E04

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Police officers form a human chain as they attempt the dramatic rescue of a family of four during Tropical Storm Imelda, which unleashed record-breaking floods on Texas

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The Repair Shop: A Royal Visit: In an episode recorded in autumn 2021 to mark the BBC's centenary, Jay Blades meets King Charles III, who was then the Prince of Wales, to explore their shared passion of preserving heritage craft skills. Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet
S03E07

programme.desc: On the eve of their high-school graduation, two academic superstars and best friends realise they should have worked less and played more. Determined not to fall short of their peers, the girls try to cram four years of fun into one night. Comedy directed by Olivia Wilde and starring Kaitlyn Dever, Beanie Feldstein and Jessica Williams

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at Hawkr Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?
S02E05

S16E01

programme.desc:
The fourth quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition
S02E06

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: HM The King's Coronation: The Eve of the Coronation
programme.desc: Kirsty Young is joined by a range of guests who give personal insights into the King and Queen Consort as they look ahead to the coronation. Sophie Raworth joins from outside Westminster Abbey, while JJ Chalmers speaks to members of the armed forces as they prepare for one of the biggest military parades in British living memory

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc:
Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun
S01E01

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. Throughout the morning, a series of films explore the King's passions, while across the capital a team of presenters are in key locations to report and commentate on the day as events unfold. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King

programme.title: Tangled (2010)
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi

programme.desc:

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Leeds United at Etihad Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Crystal Palace at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. programme.title: The Producers (1968)
programme.desc: A crooked Broadway producer and his neurotic accountant discover they can make a fortune by putting on a play that closes on opening night, then pocketing the unspent budget. The duo set out to put on the worst show of all time - a tasteless little number called Springtime for Hitler written by a deranged former Nazi. Mel Brooks' comedy, starring Zero Mostel, Gene Wilder and Kenneth Mars

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Coronation Kitchen Live: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Jennie Bond and Gyles Brandreth for a special celebratory edition of the show to mark the Coronation of King Charles III. Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Coronation: the UK Celebrates - Live
programme.desc: Reports from around the nation about how people marked the occasion of the crowning of King Charles and Queen Camilla yesterday

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. Throughout the morning, a series of films explore the King's passions, while across the capital a team of presenters are in key locations to report and commentate on the day as events unfold. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.title: Tangled (2010)
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Coronation Kitchen Live: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Jennie Bond and Gyles Brandreth for a special celebratory edition of the show to mark the Coronation of King Charles III. Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Coronation: the UK Celebrates - Live
programme.desc: Reports from around the nation about how people marked the occasion of the crowning of King Charles and Queen Camilla yesterday

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round
S19E13

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

They must fight to escape elimination as they work on supporting actors to deliver flawless, flirtatious looks that catch the eye and take risks but stay within the theme of the show. At the Glow Up Studios the MUAs have to create a look on themselves which reveals a secret untold that will impress the judges and keep them out of the first Face Off elimination

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Newcastle United v Arsenal at St James' Park and West Ham United v Manchester United at London Stadium. The Gunners and Magpies shared the spoils at St James' Park in January, but both teams were in need of three points this time around. Meanwhile, the Red Devils faced a test of their top-four credentials against a West Ham side that had shown signs of improvement in recent weeks. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round
S19E13

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

They must fight to escape elimination as they work on supporting actors to deliver flawless, flirtatious looks that catch the eye and take risks but stay within the theme of the show. At the Glow Up Studios the MUAs have to create a look on themselves which reveals a secret untold that will impress the judges and keep them out of the first Face Off elimination

programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Coronation Kitchen Live: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Jennie Bond and Gyles Brandreth for a special celebratory edition of the show to mark the Coronation of King Charles III. Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Coronation: the UK Celebrates - Live
programme.desc: Reports from around the nation about how people marked the occasion of the crowning of King Charles and Queen Camilla yesterday

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: South Today
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Newcastle United v Arsenal at St James' Park and West Ham United v Manchester United at London Stadium. The Gunners and Magpies shared the spoils at St James' Park in January, but both teams were in need of three points this time around. Meanwhile, the Red Devils faced a test of their top-four credentials against a West Ham side that had shown signs of improvement in recent weeks. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round
S19E13

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

At the Glow Up Studios the MUAs have to create a look on themselves which reveals a secret untold that will impress the judges and keep them out of the first Face Off elimination

He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.desc: A crooked Broadway producer and his neurotic accountant discover they can make a fortune by putting on a play that closes on opening night, then pocketing the unspent budget.
