programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Coronation Kitchen Live: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Jennie Bond and Gyles Brandreth for a special celebratory edition of the show to mark the Coronation of King Charles III. Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Coronation: the UK Celebrates - Live
programme.desc: Reports from around the nation about how people marked the occasion of the crowning of King Charles and Queen Camilla yesterday

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The Repair Shop: A Royal Visit: In an episode recorded in autumn 2021 to mark the BBC's centenary, Jay Blades meets King Charles III, who was then the Prince of Wales, to explore their shared passion of preserving heritage craft skills. Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet

Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at Hawkr Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The highs and lows of life with the residents of Albert Square, Walford

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round
S19E13

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

They must fight to escape elimination as they work on supporting actors to deliver flawless, flirtatious looks that catch the eye and take risks but stay within the theme of the show. At the Glow Up Studios the MUAs have to create a look on themselves which reveals a secret untold that will impress the judges and keep them out of the first Face Off elimination

programme.desc:
Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Newcastle United v Arsenal at St James' Park and West Ham United v Manchester United at London Stadium. The Gunners and Magpies shared the spoils at St James' Park in January, but both teams were in need of three points this time around. Meanwhile, the Red Devils faced a test of their top-four credentials against a West Ham side that had shown signs of improvement in recent weeks. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round
S19E13

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

In the first assignment the competitors head to a film studio in Greater London to meet hair and make-up designer Erika Okvist on the set of Bridgerton. They must fight to escape elimination as they work on supporting actors to deliver flawless, flirtatious looks that catch the eye and take risks but stay within the theme of the show. At the Glow Up Studios the MUAs have to create a look on themselves which reveals a secret untold that will impress the judges and keep them out of the first Face Off elimination

First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition
S02E06

programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg is your guide as the votes are counted in 2023’s bumper set of elections. BBC correspondents are at the key counts all around the country. In the studio, Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens, and Professor Sir John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC’s political editor, Chris Mason, analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Penang to Kuala Kangsar: Michael Portillo's 2,500-mile rail tour of south-east Asia reaches Malaysia. On the island of Penang, he traces the origins of the former British colony in Georgetown, rides one of the world's steepest funicular railways and is enchanted by exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary. Travelling on the nation's hi-tech railway network Michael visits its wettest town, Taiping, and learns how the discovery of tin made this land a prized possession for Britain. Next stop is the regal town of Kuala Kangsar, home to the Sultan of Perak and to one of Malaysia's most prestigious schools
S01E15

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Lincoln to Nottingham: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham
S04E03

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Michael Palin sets out to find the Indian sailors who took him on a slow boat from Dubai to Mumbai 20 years ago during the filming of his first travelogue Around the World in 80 Days. During an intense week at sea in 1988, he and the film crew learned to admire and respect the underpaid deckhands of the dhow Al Shama in whose hands they had placed themselves, and their farewell was a memorably emotional occasion. The return visit offers a chance to see how the teeming city has developed in the Asian economic boom and discover whether the ancient sailing ship is still afloat

programme.title: Michael Palin's Quest for Artemisia
programme.desc: The Monty Python star sets off on a quest to investigate the story of little-known 17th-century Italian artist Artemisia Gentileschi after one of her paintings caught his eye. Michael encounters her work in Florence, Rome and Naples, and finds out about her life as a working mother and her ultimate success against all odds as a great painter of the Baroque age who transformed the way women were depicted in art, and who was sought after in many courts across Europe

programme.title: East of Ipswich
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Richard Burrill is dragged to the seaside by his parents where he meets Edwin, another teenager with strong views on life, and a Dutch girl with an eye for the boys. Nostalgic comedy, starring John Nettleton and written by Michael Palin

programme.title: Victoria & Albert: The Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley oversees a restaging of the wedding of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Aided by food historian Annie Gray, clothing expert Harriet Waterhouse and military historian Jasdeep Singh, she recreates the most important elements of the ceremony and the celebrations, scouring history books, archives, newspapers and Victoria's diaries for the exact details of the couple's big day in 1840. Lucy also recounts the story of Victoria and Albert's courtship and engagement, exploring the hidden iconography and symbolism of this hugely significant wedding and revealing new insights into the pair's relationship, both public and private

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Penang to Kuala Kangsar: Michael Portillo's 2,500-mile rail tour of south-east Asia reaches Malaysia. On the island of Penang, he traces the origins of the former British colony in Georgetown, rides one of the world's steepest funicular railways and is enchanted by exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary. Travelling on the nation's hi-tech railway network Michael visits its wettest town, Taiping, and learns how the discovery of tin made this land a prized possession for Britain. Next stop is the regal town of Kuala Kangsar, home to the Sultan of Perak and to one of Malaysia's most prestigious schools
S01E15

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Lincoln to Nottingham: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham
S04E03

programme.title: A Portrait of Carol Shields: Dressing Up for the Carnival
programme.desc: Documentary charting the distinguished career of the award-winning novelist and the long battle with cancer to which she succumbed in 2003 at the age of 68. Born in Chicago in 1957, Carol Shields settled in Canada and went on to raise five children and publish 16 novels, scooping the Pulitzer Prize for her book The Stone Diaries along the way. Interview footage with Carol, her daughters and a selection of her literary peers highlight the life of a gentle unassuming writer

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Michael Palin sets out to find the Indian sailors who took him on a slow boat from Dubai to Mumbai 20 years ago during the filming of his first travelogue Around the World in 80 Days. During an intense week at sea in 1988, he and the film crew learned to admire and respect the underpaid deckhands of the dhow Al Shama in whose hands they had placed themselves, and their farewell was a memorably emotional occasion. The return visit offers a chance to see how the teeming city has developed in the Asian economic boom and discover whether the ancient sailing ship is still afloat

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kuala Kangsar to Cameron Highlands: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of South-east Asia continues in Malaysia, along the way learning how rubber engineering ensures railway passengers enjoy a smooth ride
S01E16

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxton's famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters
S04E04

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Great Railway Journeys of the World: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland. Part of The Golden Age of Steam season
S01E04

programme.title: A Fish Called Wanda (1988)
programme.desc: A stuffy English barrister representing a jewel thief is targeted by his client's partners in crime - a seductive American crook and her dim-witted would-be philosopher lover who will go to any lengths to discover where the diamonds from their last heist have been hidden. Crime comedy, starring John Cleese, Jamie Lee Curtis, Kevin Kline, Michael Palin and Tom Georgeson

programme.title: Blue Murder at St Trinian's (1957)
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls travel by coach to Europe, accompanied by a wanted jewel thief dressed as a woman, and an undercover police detective. Comedy, starring Lionel Jeffries, Joyce Grenfell, Terry-Thomas, George Cole and Alistair Sim

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc:
Great British Comedies: Talking Pictures: Interviews with British comedy stars of the silver screen, featuring the likes of George Formby, Peter Sellers and the Monty Python team. Narrated by Sylvia Syms
S02E16

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kuala Kangsar to Cameron Highlands: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of South-east Asia continues in Malaysia, along the way learning how rubber engineering ensures railway passengers enjoy a smooth ride
S01E16

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxton's famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters
S04E04

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Great Railway Journeys of the World: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland. Part of The Golden Age of Steam season
S01E04

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1994: Bruno Brookes introduces an edition originally broadcast on 18 August 1994, featuring performances by Oasis, Tinman, Eternal, Youssou N'dour Feat. Neneh Cherry, and Boyz Ii Men

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claire Sturgess presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 September 1994 and featuring Blur and Phil Daniels, Sean Maguire, Terrorvision, Youssou N'Dour and Neneh Cherry, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Children for Rwanda, Boyz II Men, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1977: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from May 5, 1977, a week that saw Deniece Williams top the chart for the first time with her single Free. The show also features performances by Joy Sarney, Rod Stewart, Frankie Valli, Bay City Rollers, Mac & Katie Kissoon, Mr Big, Leo Sayer, Delegation and Tavares

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1984: Mike Read and Steve Wright host the May 3, 1984 show, featuring OMD, Blancmange, New Order, Kenny Loggins, Jocelyn Brown, the Human League and Duran Duran

programme.title: Fanny: The Right to Rock
programme.desc: The story of critically acclaimed 1970s all-woman Filipino rock group Fanny, who despite critical acclaim and regular tours with bands including Chicago, Steely Dan and Slade, faced both sexism and racism. Now as they re-form to record a new album in their seventies, they challenge the stigma of ageism as well. With contributions from Bonnie Raitt, Todd Rundgren, the Runaways' Cherie Currie, Lovin' Spoonful's John Sebastien, Def Leppard's Joe Elliott, David Bowie's guitarist Earl Slick and bassist Gail Ann Dorsey, and Steely Dan's Jeff 'Skunk' Baxter

programme.title: Girls in Bands at the BBC
programme.desc: Compilation of performances by some of the best female musicians in rock, from the 1970s to the present day. Artists featured include American rock group Fanny, the powerful vocals of Elkie Brooks on Vinegar Joe's Proud to Be a Honky Tonk Woman, the poetry of Patti Smith's Horses and upbeat energy of the Go-Go's on We Got the Beat

programme.title: Siouxsie and the Banshees: Rock Goes to College
programme.desc: Pete Drummond introduces a 1981 performance by the gothic new wave band at Warwick University, with songs including Israel, Spellbound, Arabian Knights, Halloween and Christine

programme.title: Radio 2 Live at Home
programme.desc: Chrissie Hynde and the band recorded for Radio 2 in 2020, with favourites including Brass in Pocket, Stop Your Sobbing, Back on the Chain Gang and I'll Stand By You, as well as a few new numbers

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1994: Bruno Brookes introduces an edition originally broadcast on 18 August 1994, featuring performances by Oasis, Tinman, Eternal, Youssou N'dour Feat. Neneh Cherry, and Boyz Ii Men

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claire Sturgess presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 September 1994 and featuring Blur and Phil Daniels, Sean Maguire, Terrorvision, Youssou N'Dour and Neneh Cherry, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Children for Rwanda, Boyz II Men, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1977: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from May 5, 1977, a week that saw Deniece Williams top the chart for the first time with her single Free. The show also features performances by Joy Sarney, Rod Stewart, Frankie Valli, Bay City Rollers, Mac & Katie Kissoon, Mr Big, Leo Sayer, Delegation and Tavares

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1984: Mike Read and Steve Wright host the May 3, 1984 show, featuring OMD, Blancmange, New Order, Kenny Loggins, Jocelyn Brown, the Human League and Duran Duran

programme.title: For Folk's Sake: Morris Dancing and Me
programme.desc: Richard Macer infiltrates morris dancing's endangered world of bells, beer and beards, discovering that women may be the unlikely saviours of this ancient masculine tradition

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Absolute Desert: Michael reaches the city of Timbuktu, along with a camel train carrying the giant salt blocks that made the city one of the greatest centres of Islamic learning. Later, Michael finally gets to grips with the heart and soul of the desert
S01E03

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Passage to India: The adventurer continues his journey, travelling from K2 in Pakistan to Ladakh in India, a relatively short distance geographically, but one that will take a considerable feat of logistics owing to the region's politics. He passes through the Sikh city of Amritsar, spends time on a houseboat on Lake Dal, discovers his previous incarnations at the Astrological Institute, then travels on to an appointment with the Dalai Lama
S01E02

programme.title: Homeward (2019)
programme.desc: Mustafa, a Crimean Tatar, and his son Alim transport the body of Mustafa's other son, a soldier killed in combat, from Kyiv to Crimea to give him a proper burial. Drama, starring Akhtem Seitablaev and Remzi Bilyalov. In Crimean Tatar, Ukrainian and Russian

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Golden Gordon: Michael Palin and Terry Jones wrote this classic comedy, in which Palin stars as a soccer fan whose obsession with the world's worst team causes misery for both him and his long-suffering family. With Gwen Taylor and Bill Fraser. First shown in 1979
S02E02

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Roger of the Raj: Youngster Roger Bartlesham experiences a sexual awakening in colonial India, but the emotional turmoil leads him to commit a deplorable act. Final episode of the comedy series, starring Michael Palin, Richard Vernon, John Le Mesurier and Joan Sanderson. First shown in 1979
S02E03

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Why?: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench
S02E04

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Cold Feet: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam
S01E03

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Beyond the Rainbow: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease
S01E03

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Dire Straits: The actor embarks on the last leg of his journey, passing through the dramatic mountains of the Hoggar Massif, visiting Libya and crossing into Tunisia, where he relives the filming of The Life of Brian. He also visits Algiers and the Spanish enclave of Ceuta before finishing the expedition where he started - Gibraltar
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Passage to India: The adventurer continues his journey, travelling from K2 in Pakistan to Ladakh in India, a relatively short distance geographically, but one that will take a considerable feat of logistics owing to the region's politics. He passes through the Sikh city of Amritsar, spends time on a houseboat on Lake Dal, discovers his previous incarnations at the Astrological Institute, then travels on to an appointment with the Dalai Lama
S01E02

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: The last of three programmes originally shown in 1977 to celebrate Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee, and celebrating the landscape of England, Scotland and Wales from a unique perspective. Here, Iain Cuthbertson narrates this documentary taking a helicopter's-eye view of Scotland, taking viewers north to Shetland, south to the Tweed and everywhere in between

programme.title: Spring Soul and Jazz from Cheltenham
programme.desc: Guy Barker's Big Band and the BBC Concert Orchestra join forces at the Cheltenham Jazz Festival, with guest performers including Kurt Elling, Mica Paris, Madeline Bell, Mica Millar, Ashton Jones, Vanessa Haynes, Tommy Blaize and Ian Shaw. They play music celebrating the jazz and soul explosion of the late 1950s, and with over 80 musicians on stage and a great line-up of guests, it promises to be an extraordinary night of music. Presented by Marcus Brigstocke

programme.title: Crossing England in a Punt: River of Dreams
programme.desc: Tom Fort embarks on a 170-mile journey down the River Trent in his own custom-built punt. The presenter encounters the power stations that generate much of the nation's electricity, meets veterans of the floods of 1947 and learns about a Bronze Age boatman who made a life on the banks as he discovers the waterway's 3,000-year history

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Resident choreographer at the Royal Ballet and director of his own dance company, Wayne McGregor's dance achievements know no bounds both at home and internationally. Alan Yentob joins Wayne over a busy few months, from his role as director at the Venice Dance Biennale, creating a new production with his own company of dancers, to the rehearsals and opening of The Dante Project, a new ballet at the Royal Opera House in London

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc:
Life in the German capital in the year the Second World War ended, told through the stories of those who experienced it - from ordinary Germans to the Allied forces who entered the city. At the beginning of 1945, Berlin remains under the spell of the Nazi promise of salvation, an illusion at odds with the city's daily reality of bombing raids, fires to be extinguished and corpses to be buried. Life goes on as the front lines of the war close in each day
S01E01

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: The last of three programmes originally shown in 1977 to celebrate Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee, and celebrating the landscape of England, Scotland and Wales from a unique perspective. Here, Iain Cuthbertson narrates this documentary taking a helicopter's-eye view of Scotland, taking viewers north to Shetland, south to the Tweed and everywhere in between

programme.title: Victoria & Albert: The Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley oversees a restaging of the wedding of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Aided by food historian Annie Gray, clothing expert Harriet Waterhouse and military historian Jasdeep Singh, she recreates the most important elements of the ceremony and the celebrations, scouring history books, archives, newspapers and Victoria's diaries for the exact details of the couple's big day in 1840. Lucy also recounts the story of Victoria and Albert's courtship and engagement, exploring the hidden iconography and symbolism of this hugely significant wedding and revealing new insights into the pair's relationship, both public and private

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kuala Lumpur to Melaka: Michael Portillo explores the growth of Kuala Lumpur, from a swampland tin mine to a major British colony, before becoming a major economic powerhouse in its own right. He makers jewellery at the Royal Selangor pewter factory, samples Malaysia's national dish, and investigates the scandalous behaviour of an infamous British resident general at the turn of the 20th century
S01E17

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
The Early Pioneers: The development of steam power, from the earliest experiments in the ancient world to modern-day nuclear power stations. Fred travels to Cornwall to investigate the use of early engines to pump water out of the tin mines
S01E01

programme.title: Cornwall's Red River
programme.desc: Poet John Wedgwood Clarke explores the Red River in Cornwall. Despite being heavily polluted by centuries of tin mining, it is also home to some rare and resilient wildlife

programme.title: David Attenborough's Zoo Quest in Colour
programme.desc: A one-off special showcasing colour footage from the 1950s wildlife series that launched the career of a young David Attenborough as a nature presenter. Using new-found film and behind-the-scenes stories from Attenborough and cameraman Charles Lague, this programme features clips of the best of Zoo Quest to West Africa, Zoo Quest to Guiana and Zoo Quest for a Dragon

programme.title: David Attenborough: A Life on Air
programme.desc: In 1952, David Attenborough was turned down for a job with BBC radio, only to end up working for the corporation's fledgling TV service - eventually becoming director of programmes. Since then he has become one of the most respected wildlife film-makers in the business, fronting classic series such as Life on Earth, The Blue Planet and Planet Earth. He talks to Michael Palin about his half-century at the corporation

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alice Neel: Imagine: Born in 1900, American artist Alice Neel portrayed the 20th century until her death in 1984, painting the people around her - those on the margins of society as well as the ones involved in her own hard and complicated life. This profile of Neel was made by her grandson Andrew, who combines home-movie footage and candid interviews with family and friends

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Pulse: Documentary exploring the importance of water to civilisation, beginning with a look at how just a few drops can cause deserts to bloom, create rivers in the air and drive the great animal migrations
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
What Happens in Helmand: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Toy Soldier: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Truffle Hog: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn
S01E03

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Melaka to Johor Bahru: Michael Portillo arrives in Melaka, for centuries one of the greatest trading ports in the world, where he tastes the spicy cuisine of the Kristang community. Continuing to Kluang amid fertile farmland, Michael joins in the pineapple harvest and discovers how Malaysia's resources of tin and tropical fruit created a global market in food. Finally, he arrives at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula in Johor Bahru
S01E18

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
The Age of the Steam Locomotive: The revolution in transport brought about by steam power, charting the technology's development from the earliest colliery railways, through the first passenger train services and to the end of an era in the 1960s
S01E02

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc:
Stranger: Eric and Hattie are visited by a stranger who has returned to honour a promise made in his childhood. Vintage comedy first shown in 1972, guest starring Peter Sellers alongside Hattie Jacques and Eric Sykes
S01E06

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc:
Spy Ring: Eric and Hattie become suspicious of their vodka-swilling, well-off new neighbours. Vintage comedy, starring Eric Sykes and Hattie Jacques
S02E03

programme.title: Eric Sykes: One of the Great Troupers
programme.desc: The veteran comedian takes to the stage of the Theatre Royal, Lincoln, where he gives a tongue-in-cheek account of his follies and fortunes as an actor, gag writer and comedian in theatre, radio and TV. He also pays tribute to Hattie Jacques and Richard Watts, the co-stars of his long-running Sykes sitcom, and there are appearances from Eddie Lester, John Evans and Tony Hayes

programme.title: Wild Scotland
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan takes a trip home to the island of Mull where he has just one day to film the rare sea eagle. While searching for a nest site, he spots a host of other wildlife

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: UK artist and film-maker Lisa Selby turns the camera on herself as she tries to understand her relationship with her late mother and her partner, both heroin addicts

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Melaka to Johor Bahru: Michael Portillo arrives in Melaka, for centuries one of the greatest trading ports in the world, where he tastes the spicy cuisine of the Kristang community. Continuing to Kluang amid fertile farmland, Michael joins in the pineapple harvest and discovers how Malaysia's resources of tin and tropical fruit created a global market in food. Finally, he arrives at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula in Johor Bahru
S01E18

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
The Age of the Steam Locomotive: The revolution in transport brought about by steam power, charting the technology's development from the earliest colliery railways, through the first passenger train services and to the end of an era in the 1960s
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Blind Spots: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised
S01E04

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
A Pilgrim of Justice: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger
S01E05

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Correction: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama
S01E06

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Raffles Place to Botanic Gardens: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown
S01E19

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Driving the Wheels of Industry: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century
S01E03

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc:
Travellers: Chris takes a look at nature's best navigators, with mule deer building up complicated memory maps of their landscapes so they don't get lost, while elephants rely on the knowledge of the herd's matriarch to find precious waterholes. Dung beetles plot routes by reading the stars, while the mantis shrimp has one of the most complex navigation systems in the natural world. For many species of fish and birds, there's safety in numbers and they often travel in vast shoals and flocks - but who leads the way, and how do they decide?
S01E06

programme.title: World of Stonehenge
programme.desc: Neil Oliver reports on a 5,000-year-old temple discovered in Orkney. Built 500 years before Stonehenge, the undisturbed artefacts found there, including wall decorations, pigments and paint pots, are helping to increase knowledge and understanding of the Neolithic people. Special effects are used to re-create the structure in 3D, allowing Neil to walk inside and explore it

programme.title: The Lost Language of Cranes (1991)
programme.desc: A young man comes out to his parents, causing repercussions for his father, who has long since been trying his own sexuality and realises he can no longer live a lie. Drama, starring Brian Cox, Brian Cox, Eileen Atkins and Angus Macfadyen

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Adventure & Exploration: Broadcaster David Dimbleby sails his yacht Rocket around the British coastline, exploring different aspects of the nation's maritime history, art and architecture along the way. He begins by sailing the south-west coast of Devon and Cornwall, where he tells the story of Sir Francis Drake and an array of adventurers, explorers, pirates and smugglers. He also welcomes record-breaking solo yachtswoman Ellen MacArthur on board and learns about one of the oldest maritime art forms of all - the tattoo, before agreeing to have one himself
S01E01

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Raffles Place to Botanic Gardens: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown
S01E19

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:

S01E03

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Pulse: Documentary exploring the importance of water to civilisation, beginning with a look at how just a few drops can cause deserts to bloom, create rivers in the air and drive the great animal migrations
